reviews.title: First Time Fantastic
reviews.text: Our family of four booked a five day stay at the Marriott Sanibel Harbour resort for our summer vacation this year. This was our first visit to this region of Florida and we were very excited to experience the beaches of Sanibel and Captiva islands. I chose the Marriott property because of its location to the island beaches and to Fort Myers and Naples, which we also wanted to visit. The Marriott resort also offered amenities that I thought would work best for our kids

reviews.title: Great location & beautiful hotel.
reviews.text: (ages 11 and 9) that I did not find at properties on Sanibel itself: multiple pools, multiple restaurants, etc. And finally, our choice was based on our having joined Marriott's Rewards program this year and this would be our second vacation in their program.

reviews.title: Great Stay
reviews.text: I had originally booked a king suite for four nights at $219/night with the fees and taxes. Two days before our departure , I checked the hotel's website and found that the executive 1br suite rate ( a better room) was $159/night and made the change to our reservation online. This saved us almost $250 on the overall lodging cost and I APPLAUD Marriott for having such an easy to use website. The revised reservation updated itself immediately with the new room and the new rate under the existing confirmation and there was no drama at check-in.

reviews.title: An amazing getaway!
reviews.text: We arrived mid-afternoon on a Tuesday. At check-in, the desk clerk (Ricardo) noted our rewards membership and upgraded our suite to a top floor room overlooking the pool. He called it "the best room" in the resort and joked it was the presidential suite. I admit to being skeptical about the proclamation, but upon seeing it a few minutes later, I admit that the room was stunning and easily one of the best suites we've had for family travel in the U.S.

reviews.title: Great location, good service, but property needs some TLC.
reviews.text: The room opened into a small foyer with a mini fridge near the door. The living space had a full size sofa (w/ pullout bed), large, solid chairs, a round dining table with seating for four, a minibar cabinet with extra shelving. The room was well decorated and a lot of the furnishings appeared to be new. The main room opened to a wide balcony with two chairs and table. The TV was at least 48" size lcd and had DVD and game system unit hookups. Double doors opened into the bedroom which had more than enough floor space for the king bed, tv and armoire, a full size chaise , and a small desk with aero chair in the corner. The bedroom also had a balcony. The bathroom was equally large with a soaker tub, walk-in shower with multiple shower head options ( rain, handheld, point nozzles), double sinks and a separate toilet room. And on a side note, the room's lighting was excellent throughout the suite.

reviews.title: Ideal location
reviews.text: This resort has all the amenities you would expect. Our room was really a mini suite with a kitchenette, dining table and chairs, couch and armchairs, desk, two televisions, king bed, walk-in closet, balcony facing the ocean, all in one large space... ideal for a couple traveling without children and in the company of friends. The pool and tennis courts were as expected, food was expensive but well prepared and promptly served. There is no beach of any significance; but that provides your reason for a trip across the bridge to Sanibel. The best feature of this resort is its location. It is less than a minute from the causeway bridge to Sanibel Island. Excursions are easily scheduled without the traffic and congestion encountered on the island during times of peak activity. Trips to Fort Myers or to other inland destinations do not require the extra time required to come ashore from Sanibel. Our view of the causeway was lovely, the sea breezes abundant. This hotel offers ready access to island beaches and attractions with the convenience of easy travel to mainland shopping and restaurants.

reviews.title: Had an awesome family vacation!!
reviews.text: There were families to be seen at the pool; but the majority of guests in November were on the senior side and the atmosphere was pretty tame.

reviews.title: Lovely Weekend Stay
reviews.text: Very clean, family friendly environment. Kids had a blast at the pool. Food was great, lots of eating out options nearby. Only two down sides. The pool side chairs and towels were not ready/available most of the time and also to visit captiva island there is a $6 toll everytime you visit.

reviews.title: They don't care about elite members
reviews.text: My Fiance and I flew down to The Marriott Sanibel Harbour Resory & Spa literally for 30 hours. We are from NJ and we fly down to check the place out to book our wedding here for May, 2014. My dad gave us some points for a room, as he is a gold member with over 150,000 points. Upon check in, we were upgraded to the Sanibel Tower with a Harbour view, without even asking (Room 697 i think?)! I was very surprised after all the reviews I read.

reviews.title: Amazing "carribean" vacation however in the U.S!!!
reviews.text: We had lunch at the pool side restaurant (forget the name) and it was awesome! We shared the Lobster Mac & Cheese and both had the Lobster Roll. All made with fresh lobster meat apparently flown in right from Maine, and is never frozen! Our waitress was awesome, and gave us good recommendations of a bar local to the property.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I went here for some time away from the snow. From the very first step on the property I felt welcome. We don't use the assistance for the car or the luggage but the men were very accommodating and nice. I got a call upon arriving in my room and then again when we were about to check out asking how my room was and could they do anything to make our stay more comfortable. I gave this property a 5 star because it was clean friendly and a pleasure to stay at.
reviews.title: Wonderful visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When booking this hotel online, given the perceived location, and price for the room, I expected a lot more.
reviews.title: Definitely less than I expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is away from everything, and though a "resort", it doesn't seem you could do without going out. My review is based on what I paid for, and expected from a Marriott.
reviews.title: Over priced

reviews.text: ABOUT THE PLACE: First, we were assigned a room in a building away from the main building (Captiva). That wouldn't be a problem normally, but the feeling there was of being on your own.
reviews.title: Nice room for a short stay for New Years

reviews.text: ABOUT THE SERVICE: There is a "lobby" in this Captiva building, but we were there 3 times, and there was never anybody there to speak with. If we wanted something, we had to pick up a phone, and call the main building for service. We did not feel attended, but hurting for service instead
reviews.title: Beautiful resort!
Pleasantly surprised!!
reviews.text: Really happy with this stay. Very relaxed feel .... Although there is no beach access, the waterfront view and other amenities make up for it... and Sanibel Island is only a short drive away. If you have a choice ...stay in the Sanibel tower. Can't beat the sunset views!!!

reviews.title: Not well managed
reviews.text: My wife and I planned a visit there to celebrate her birthday and 4th of July. The hotel was very crowded with lots of kids that were not supervised. My wife had a very ugly confrontation with several teen boys, and hotel security seemed quite unconcerned even though I witnessed that they verbally threatened her with violence and called her names I can not print here. Not much better at the pool, noisy, crowded, ill-mannered. Hotel clearly needs to better train their staff. I would not stay here again or recommend this hotel, there are better in the area for less money.

reviews.title: Great getaway
reviews.text: Had a great time here at the Marriot Harbour in Sanibel. Room with a view was really nice. having multiple pool areas on the property was nice so it didn't get too crowded. Porpoises swam right up to the pier and were fun to watch. Couples massage was really nice, my first.

reviews.title: Less than what I would expect from a Marriott
reviews.text: A group of 10 girls decided to take a Girls weekend and pamper ourselves. Instead of going out our of town we decided to fuel our local economy and stay local. Sanibel Harbour has such a great reputation and we thought it would be a luxury to treat ourselves.

reviews.title: Beautiful property, nice rooms, good restaurant, great staff, no beach.
reviews.text: I have to say that I was disappointed in my room. I was in 1614 in the Captiva building. The shower had mold in the grout, the patio floor was disgusting. It has some sort of coating on it that is coming off and it is sticky and you have to use force just to move a chair from one spot to another because they stick to the floor. It was also disappointing that we all paid the same price and our building did not have any of the same amenities, there is no towel attendant or pool bar, and we had to wait on the trolley to bring us over to where the rest of our group was, the building is just not comparable,

Good News: great gym (open 24 hours) and spa and mens lounge area. Free access to gym, hot tub, sauna, steam, etc. Nice pool / hot tub area and poolside snack bar. Rooms are good size, balcony's are good size and towels are always available. Great buffet and omelette chef. Property is beautiful, you have to walk a lot but nice paths, beautiful trees and nature. Nice to have basketball on site along with tennis courts. Overall, staff is friendly and understands service although you could tell they were having some challenges.
reviews.title: Good news and bad news

reviews.text: Bad News: poor housekeeping, communication between restaurants and staff, parking and resort fees.
reviews.title: GOOD BAD AND THE UGLY

reviews.text: Really bad news: beware ending up the captiva tower. It's a shuttle or walk to any restaurant or gym and balcony's open up to a highway that is LOUD and never stops with motorcycles and trucks roaring constantly.
reviews.title: Beautiful views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Good: the overlooking bay view from Captive Tower is amazing. Sanibel Island and the Causeway views are stunning.
reviews.title: Nice hotel but EXTREMELY NOISY

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Bad: Out Dated, completely over priced, Towers are spaced so far apart you have to be shuttled between them and all amenities are in the other towers. Resort fee is a joke, this used to be a resort, the hot tub at Captiva tower is filled in with bark. $12.00 self parking is another nickel and dime. $820.00 bill for a two night stay including one restaurant visit. In their defense it was New Years Eve.
reviews.title: Overpriced
Beautiful hotel, exceptional view and wonderful staff.
reviews.text: The reviews and pictures of this hotel do not exemplify it's class and amazing ocean views. We planned on staying on the island but couldn't find any decent priced hotels so we decided on this one. I'm glad we did because although the hotel isn't on the island, it is literally a walk away from the Sanibel Island bridge. To be honest the hotel was our favorite part of our trip. The three pools were great and the views are spectacular. The best part, we feed pods of dolphins that were right next to the hotel pier, pretty amazing. And to add to our list of reasons to return, the friendly staff made our stay all the merrier. We will be back!

reviews.title: Great view
reviews.text: Rooms were nice view was awesome of harbour,pool area dated and tiki bar was dirty.not to Marriott standards very nice staff very helpful. Was disappointed the tour boat didnot run on Monday's. Use valet,staff very good at getting car quickly and only a few dollars more than self parking

reviews.title: VERY NICE
reviews.text: We were there for a conference so the rate was a group rate. However the location was really nice. Its right before the expensive $6.00 bridge beach entrance. We were in the captiva building, and it was so nice. Ocean view of the bridge, HUGE room, we also had a microwave...not sure if that is standard, as other friends didnt have that nor the fridge. Bathroom had two sinks...very nice. Huge balcony to sit out and drink coffee and relax. Everyone was friendly. Didnt eat at any of the restaurants, or use the pool. My friend went to the spa, and the sauna, steam room can be utilized by guests without a fee.

reviews.title: Extremely Disappointing -- Stay Someplace Else!
reviews.text: I stayed at the Sanibel Harbour Marriott for six days in July, attending a conference. I had been here about six years ago, thought the place was great, and was looking forward to returning. After my most recent stay, I will not come back unless and until the whole place is renovated and refreshed. The rooms all smell musty, and look dirty – dust in the corners, above the baseboards, etc. The common areas are worn out and unpleasant – most of the furniture is upholstered, and it all was stained and funky. The outside areas have not been well-tended, and the landscaping was shabby. The prices for food are extortionate ($17 for oatmeal in the restaurant and $18 for a six pack of Miller Lite in the shop). This place is not up to Marriott standards, and I am frankly surprised the corporate leadership has allowed this facility to deteriorate as it has. The location is pretty but honestly if you have to sit in a musty room or a funky terrace or a dirty poolside table to enjoy the pretty view, you should find another hotel. Go down the road to the Marco Island Marriott, which was outstanding, and pass right on by the Sanibel Marriott.

reviews.title: Fantastic hotel and beautiful location!
reviews.text: Stunning hotel with fantastic views of Sanibel Island and the surrounding bay. We had a family suite in one of the towers and it was exceptional. Everything was kept to the highest standards and the staff were friendly and helpful. The free on-call trolley service to transport you around the resort was a nice touch. The location is amazing with beautiful sunsets and white sandy beaches. It was also really nice to get away from the 'Disney/Orlando' area for a change. Certainly ideal as a two-centre option to recover from the theme parks! As a family we agreed it was our best ever holiday hotel experience! Worth paying a little bit extra for.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for a short honeymoon following our Fort Lauderdale wedding in December. Our stay wasn't bad, but it wasn't too amazing. We checked out on January 1, and I forgot my Sephora makeup kit in the hotel room. We contacted the resort, and they said they would look for it. No one called us back, so we had to call them again. We were told "it hasn't shown up yet". Housekeeping was supposed to call us, and we never heard from them. We contacted the front desk manager who sent us an incident report to file with Marriott. We sent the report on January 10, and we still have not heard anything back. We made another phone call yesterday and left a message which has not been returned. Friday will be one month since we checked out of the resort and nothing at all has been done to resolve this matter.
reviews.title: Missing makeup from hotel room

reviews.text: We have stayed at many Marriotts in the past and never had anything disappear. I sincerely hope the management at this resort is taking these types of incidents seriously and that staff is held responsible for their actions.
reviews.title: Relaxing!

reviews.text: Also, service in the hotel's outlets was extremely lackluster. After having a mediocre meal at the "Tarpon House" we had to wait about 20 minutes to get our check. The manager said the computer was tied up with a banquet or something. The next evening we had some apps and a nice bottle of wine while watching the sunset at the hotel bar. View was beautiful but our waitress simply dropped the bottle of wine and did not return to pour another glass. I guess this is what Marriott service is coming to. Guess we should stay somewhere nicer next time.
reviews.title: long weekend

reviews.text: The hotel was lovely, especially in the Captiva Tower. What I was most impressed by however, was the staff. Every person from the concierge, to the wait staff, check in staff, restaurant manager and shop staff were incredibly friendly, genuine and helpful. I can't recall the last time I stayed at a hotel where EVERY single staff member was beyond gracious. I enjoyed my stay and only wish I could have been there longer!
reviews.title: Depends on your plan

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the hotel was very clean and well managed. The frontdesk was right on top of every request and the check in process was very professional.
reviews.title: Great Stay, but Overpriced

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First let me say that his hotel is NOT on Sanibel Island like you would expect. It is the last exit before you go over the bridge to Sanibel Island. Each time you go across to Sanibel you pay a $6.00 toll. If you are smart you can buy a pass from the car rental and for $39.00 you can go through the toll as many times as you want. We were here for 5 days and it was worth it. The hotel is lovely. The rooms are beautiful, clean, and the view is spectacular. The pools are great with flags on the lounge chairs that you raise when you want a drink or food. The concierge are very helpful and the staff very friendly.
reviews.title: Sanibel Harbour Resort and Spa

reviews.text: The view is tremendous. The staff is especially attentive and friendly. I was here on business with a group of 24. They really took good care of us. Not sure I'd come for vacation, though. There's really nothing around the hotel, so you're on property unless you have a car. We did have the hotel call us a car to take us to Sanibel Island. It was $26. It was a private car service and the drivers were all snow birds who drive tourists around in the winters. They're really sweet.
reviews.title: Wonderful place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were assigned the Captiva tower. They said it was because I booked through Expedia. It is too isolated from the main hotel. You have to walk quite a distance or drive to get breakfast. The beds are comfortable but the furniture in the room is all upholstered. I do not like to put my luggage or clothes on upholstered furniture because of whatever might have been there before. There was no dresser at all. There was a large table between the beds for desk purposes. On that table was a small lamp to be shared between the beds. It was difficult to read with that lamp. This tower needs updating badly. The prices were not reduced because of this.
reviews.title: not captivating

reviews.text: I stayed here for a conference and like other conference-centered resorts, you are stuck here when you are staying here unless you want to drive. You are captive to the restaurants on site and the amenities available there. I've stayed at several such resorts, usually with unhappy experiences.
reviews.title: Captive, but not Captiva

reviews.text: If you do have a car, it is in a good location -- easy drive across the causeway to Sanibel and Captiva. It is also an easy drive to Fort Myers Beach, but the traffic is unbelievable on that causeway.
reviews.title: Great Resort
